author: SudanTribune
title: UN Security Council calls for ceasefire in Sudan during Ramadan
text:
Humanitarian aid
UN Security Council calls for ceasefire in Sudan during Ramadan
February 8, 2024 (NEW YORK) ‚Äì The UN Security Council passed a vital resolution on Friday regarding Sudan. It urges all parties in the conflict to immediately stop fighting during the holy month of Ramadan, which starts this Sunday.
Adopted under Chapter VI, the resolution was adopted with only one abstention (Russia). Also, it calls for a lasting solution to the war through dialogue.
Since April 2023, clashes between the Sudanese military (SAF) and the paramilitary RSF have ravaged the capital and spread throughout the country. The brutal conflict has displaced millions, caused immense suffering, and pushed Sudan into a deep humanitarian crisis.
The Security Council deeply worries about this worsening crisis, particularly the ‚Äúcrisis levels or worse‚Äù of severe food insecurity, especially in Darfur. Furthermore, reports of violations of international law, including sexual violence, are a grave concern.
The resolution demands that all sides allow full, unrestricted humanitarian access, including across borders and conflict lines. All parties must also fulfil their legal obligations to protect civilians and uphold the ‚ÄúJeddah Declaration‚Äù protecting Sudanese civilians.
The Council urged the UN Secretary-General‚Äôs special representative, Ramtane Lamamra, to bring the warring parties and Sudan‚Äôs neighbours together to work alongside regional efforts for peace.
In a separate vote, the 15-member body extended until 12 March 2025 the mandate of the Panel of Experts originally appointed pursuant to resolution 1591 (2005). The resolution was adopted with 13 votes in favour, and 2 abstentions (China, Russian Federation).

author: Mairon Benavides Cadena"/>
title: Tres presuntos miembros del Clan del Golfo murieron en enfrentamiento con la Polic√≠a
text:
Valle del Cauca | En una operaci√≥n policial que se realiz√≥ en la vereda C√°ceres, zona rural de Roldanillo , Valle, tres presuntos miembros del Clan del Golfo perdieron la vida tras enfrentarse con la Polic√≠a. Adem√°s, un hombre fue capturado tras resultar herido.
Las autoridades han descartado que se tratara de una masacre y han confirmado que la acci√≥n fue parte de una estrategia para combatir las actividades criminales de este grupo en la regi√≥n.
Leer m√°s:
‚ÄúHabr√° seguridad para la COP16‚Ä≥: MinAmbiente Cien nuevos polic√≠as reforzar√°n la seguridad en Jamund√≠, Valle, para evitar m√°s atentados Valle del Cauca: Polic√≠a descubre alianza entre bandas criminales y disidencias FARC El coronel Giovanni Cristancho, comandante de la Polic√≠a Valle, inform√≥ que los individuos armados con una subametralladora mini Uzi, una pistola, un revolver y una escopeta fueron interceptados por los comandos policiales mientras ejecutaban una orden de allanamiento.
‚ÄúTras recibir varias denuncias por extorsi√≥n e intimidaciones por personas que se identificaban como miembros del Clan del Golfo, llegamos hasta esa vereda a cumplir con el procedimiento policial. Sin embargo, fuimos recibidos a disparos por cuatro hombres. En el cruce de disparos, tres de ellos murieron y uno m√°s se captur√≥‚Äù, explic√≥ el coronel Cristancho.
El capturado fue entregado a las autoridades judiciales para su procesamiento. El Ej√©rcito y la Polic√≠a han reiterado que las operaciones contra el Clan del Golfo en el norte del Valle continuar√°n.
Se ha reportado un aumento en los asesinatos en Trujillo y Bol√≠var, atribuidos a disputas por el control del microtr√°fico entre el Clan del Golfo y bandas locales.

author: Lizbeth Garc√≠a
title: Se incendia tr√°iler sobre la autopista M√©xico-Quer√©taro, en Cuautitl√°n Izcalli
text: Caos e intensa carga vehicular se registr√≥ esta tarde en la autopista M√©xico-Quer√©taro, debido al incendio de un tr√°iler de carga ocurrido a la altura de la colonia La Quebrada, en el municipio de Cuautitl√°n Izcalli, en el Estado de M√©xico. La intensa columna de humo se pudo ver a varios kil√≥metros a la redonda, lo que provoc√≥ que por momentos hubiera poca visibilidad en la zona, as√≠ que las autoridades, que ya se encontraban en el lugar, cerraran tanto carriles centrales como laterales mientras los bomberos trabajaban para sofocar el incendio. En el lugar se presentaron tambi√©n param√©dicos del municipio mexiquense, sin embargo, no se reportaron personas heridas y algunos medios indicaron que el conductor result√≥ ileso, por lo que s√≥lo se mantuvieron alertas en caso de que alg√∫n bombero solicitara su ayuda. [Lee m√°s: Famoso tatuador fue la v√≠ctima del tr√°gico accidente en Atizap√°n](https://news.culturacolectiva.com/noticias/mexico/tatuador-conocido-muere-accidente-atizapan/) üî¥¬°TOMA PRECAUCIONES! üî¥ üöí Se registra el incendio de un tr√°iler en carriles centrales de la autopista M√©xico-Quer√©taro, a la altura del cento comercial Punta Norte, en la zona de la Quebrada, municipio de Cuautitl√°n Izcalli üé• [#VIDEO]Especial [pic.twitter.com/axQ7H1T6CN] ‚Äî El Universal (@El_Universal_Mx) [December 27, 2023] Incendio del tr√°iler se debi√≥ a fallas mec√°nicas Sin que hasta el momento se sepa el motivo del incendio, la cabeza del tr√°iler qued√≥ totalmente consumida por el fuego. El conductor indica que comenz√≥ a sentir fallas en la pesada unidad y cuando realiz√≥ un cambio de velocidad, empez√≥ a salir humo del motor. En ese instante baj√≥ del tr√°iler para intentar revisar lo que ocurr√≠a, pero el fuego se intensific√≥ r√°pidamente, por lo que s√≥lo pudo llamar a los servicios de emergencia para que pudieran auxiliarlo, mientras tanto, desde ese momento, quienes circulaban por el lugar tuvieron que parar sus veh√≠culos y esperar el arribo de los bomberos. Debido a ello, la vialidad, con direcci√≥n a Lecher√≠a, qued√≥ totalmente colapsada, mientras los bomberos sofocaban el incendio y la Guardia Nacional resguard√≥ el lugar; mientras, la pesada unidad est√° siendo removida y hasta el momento s√≥lo un carril ha sido reabierto a la circulaci√≥n. El tractocami√≥n, perteneciente a la empresa Transportes Terrestres El Roble y viajaba sin carga, lo que ayud√≥ a que al ser retirado de la vialidad, no se presenten m√°s complicaciones, por el momento, se pide utilizar v√≠as alternas mientras es reabierta en su totalidad la circulaci√≥n. [Sigue leyendo: CNDH responsabiliza al IMSS por muerte de menor en elevador de un hospital en Quintana Roo](https://news.culturacolectiva.com/noticias/mexico/cndh-responsabiliza-imss-muerte-menor-elevador/) Bomberos de Cuautitl√°n Izcalli trabajan para sofocar incendio de tr√°iler en la M√©xico-Quer√©taro, a la altura de La Quebrada. [#Video]üé•üëáüèΩ [pic.twitter.com/SNQOkvhuXl] ‚Äî JORGE BECERRIL JB/8 (@MrElDiablo8) [December 27, 2023] Con informaci√≥n de El Universal, Infobae / Foto de portada: captura de pantalla

author: CNN Newsource
title: Dog rescued from freezing water at Midland park - Local News 8
text:
By Web Staff
Click here for updates on this story
 MIDLAND, Michigan ( WNEM ) ‚Äî A dog was rescued after falling through the ice in Midland on Monday, Jan. 15.
The Midland Fire Department said it responded to a call for a dog that fell through the ice at Emerson Park in Midland while chasing some deer.
The fire department said it arrived and found the dog struggling to stay above the water in the middle of the river, adding responders attempted to retrieve the dog with a rope several times.
Rescue swimmers made their way to the dog just as he went underwater, and he was rescued and brought back to shore, the fire department said.
The fire department said the dog was given medical treatment on scene and taken to M-20 Animal Hospital.
M-20 said the dog, a 6-year-old Irish Setter named Koufax, was drenched, ice cold, and unresponsive when he was brought in and their team went into emergency mode.
After two hours, M-20 workers were able to start reading a temperature on Koufax and soon after, he was able to lift his head and was responding to voices.
M-20 said the team tried to get Koufax up and moving so he wouldn‚Äôt get a blood clot and within 20 minutes, he was licking the face of one of the employees. He enjoyed eating warm chicken and having a warm lap to sit on, the animal hospital said.
Koufax is now resting at home.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: AFP
title: Stock markets mixed as trading year nears end
text:
Stock markets diverged on the penultimate trading day of 2023 Thursday as investors cautiously look ahead to next year when the US Federal Reserve is expected to cut interest rates.
Wall Street advanced at the open but European stock markets were mixed in afternoon deals.
Asian equities mostly closed higher, with Tokyo bucking the trend as it fell.
Global stock markets have mostly been on the front foot since the Fed's most recent meeting, when it signalled its rate-hike cycle could be nearing an end as inflation slows.
"Indices have been powered higher, partly by optimism about a soft landing for the US and there is still a risk of the economy slowing more sharply as the full effect of higher borrowing costs filter through," noted Susannah Streeter, head of money and markets at Hargreaves Lansdown.
While US inflation has slowed, it remains above the Fed's long-term target of around two percent, and analysts warned that consumer spending had still not bounced back to healthy levels.
US retail sales over the key holiday shopping season were up 3.1 percent year-on-year, according to the Mastercard SpendingPulse survey, but that was markedly down from the previous year's 7.6-percent jump.
"This is a reflection of a more cautious consumer and less discounting from retailers due to better inventory management," said asset manager Louis Navellier in a note.
"While inflation is falling, the runup from last year's high rate has still squeezed budgets against a modest wage growth closer to four percent."
On the commodities front, oil prices dropped after recent gains due to concerns the Israel-Hamas war could spill out into an all-out regional conflict.
This comes amid ongoing attacks on key Red Sea shipping lanes by Yemen's Huthi rebels.
- Key figures around 1445 GMT -
New York - Dow: UP 0.1 percent at 37,683.87 points
London - FTSE 100: UP 0.1 percent at 7,735.63

author: Andrew Mobley
title: chevron-right
text: LITTLE ROCK (KATV) ‚Äî After North Little Rock's Burns Park was decimated by the [March 31st tornado](https://katv.com/news/local/national-weather-service-nws-catastrophic-tornado-moves-through-little-rock-central-arkansas-scattered-storms-forecast-severe-damaging-winds-threats-large-hail-warning-watch-deadly-dead-damage-jacksonville-cabot-river-twister-violent-chime-in-radar-maps), the city has been steadily repairing and reopening it. Yesterday, the city approved a resolution to enter a $3.1 million contract to rebuild Funland, the popular amusement park and crown jewel of Burns Park. Funland is the final piece of the puzzle in the restoration of Burns Park, and Mayor Hartwick says it'll soon be better than ever before. "I thought the council putting the money forth is very important to keeping Burns Park alive," said North Little Rock Mayor Terry Hartwick. Of the $3.1 million being invested in Funland's restoration, just over $1 million will be contributed by FEMA, Hartwick said. It's been a challenging road to recovery since the March 31st tornado. The City of North Little Rock had just installed new rides for Funland when the tornado tore through Burns Park. "On March 30, I was on a ride called the Twister‚Äîit was a brand-new ride the city just bought. Well, March 31, the twister took the Twister and it's gone," Hartwick said. Not much survived the tornado apart from, understandably, a tank, and Funland's iconic and beloved train, which many will be happy to know is going to be prominently featured in the new and improved Funland, complete with a tunnel. However, it's the new mission of Funland that's perhaps most exciting‚Äîthe amusement park's new attractions will be all-inclusive and accessible to disabled children, with, among other things, a wheelchair-accessible see-saw. "So, all kids have the same opportunities to enjoy Funland and Burns Park," Hartwick said. "It's very important to me that we keep doing that." The new Funland will also feature some of the most impressive playground sets in Arkansas and what is likely to be the largest splash pad in Central Arkansas. The companies behind the new attraction designs are Development Consultants Incorporated (DCI) and GameTime. "They've done other designs throughout the state. I guess they're one of the premier designers around‚ÄîI just told them I want it by July 4, and I want it bigger and better than anyone else has got," Hartwick laughed. Funland is a source of happy childhood memories for Hartwick, like many others. The North Little Rock mayor said he was adamant that the amusement park be restored and open to the public by Independence Day next summer. "I want the citizens, and the people, and the kids to take advantage of this by July 4 next year. That's what the intent is," Hartwick said. " The reason why I wanted the kids to be able to play [in Funland] in the summer‚ÄîI wanted to see them back in the pavilions, I want to see them in the waterslide. So that was special to me, so they made it happen...which is making Funland, Funland again."

author: Redacci√≥n Gesti√≥n
title: Jill Biden encabeza grupo para atraer voto femenino a f√≥rmula Biden-Harris | Mundo | Estados Unidos | Joe Biden | Jill Biden | Primera Dama | Nikki Haley | Donald Trump | elecciones presidenciales | MUNDO | GESTI√ìN
text: La primera dama estadounidense [Jill Biden ](https://gestion.pe/noticias/jill-biden/)encabezar√° una campa√±a para atraer el voto femenino en apoyo a la reelecci√≥n del presidente [Joe Biden ](https://gestion.pe/noticias/joe-biden/)y la vicepresidenta Kamala Harris, anunci√≥ el mi√©rcoles la campa√±a del mandatario. Las mujeres fueron parte crucial de la coalici√≥n que eligi√≥ a Biden en 2020 y su campa√±a busca recapturar ese impulso con la nueva iniciativa. La primera dama lanzar√° oficialmente la iniciativa el viernes, al comienzo del Mes de la Historia de las Mujeres, con una gira por estados que ser√°n decisivos en las elecciones de noviembre. LEA TAMBI√âN: [Biden y Trump ganan las primarias en Michigan, acerc√°ndose a una revancha] ‚ÄúFueron las mujeres quienes colocaron a Joe en la Casa Blanca hace cuatro a√±os, y lo har√°n de nuevo‚Äù, dijo la primera dama en un comunicado. ‚ÄúEn nuestras comunidades, las mujeres son las organizadoras, las planificadoras, las movilizadoras. Logramos lo que nos proponemos. Y esa es exactamente la raz√≥n por la que estamos lanzando ‚ÄòMujeres por Biden‚Äô ahora, porque cuando las mujeres organizan, ganamos‚Äù. La gira de la primera dama durar√° de viernes a domingo y abarcar√° Georgia, Arizona, Nevada y Wisconsin, que est√°n entre los estados que decidir√°n si el dem√≥crata Biden gana otros cuatro a√±os en la presidencia, o si el Partido Republicano retoma control de la Casa Blanca. El expresidente [ Donald Trump](https://gestion.pe/noticias/donald-trump/) est√° delante de la exgobernadora de Carolina del Sur, [Nikki Haley](https://gestion.pe/noticias/nikki-haley/), en la contienda por la candidatura presidencial republicana. Julie Ch√°vez Rodr√≠guez, gerente de campa√±a de Biden, dijo que las consecuencias de estas elecciones ‚Äúno podr√≠an ser m√°s importantes‚Äù. Las mujeres fueron cruciales para la derrota que le propin√≥ Biden a Trump en 2020. ‚ÄúLos estadounidenses enfrentar√°n una importante decisi√≥n en las urnas este noviembre: entre Joe y Kamala, que luchar√°n por las mujeres y sus libertades todos los d√≠as, o Donald Trump, quien desea despojarnos de nuestros derechos y libertades‚Äù, indic√≥ Rodr√≠guez en un comunicado. ‚ÄúLos republicanos han subestimado el poder de las mujeres una y otra vez. Juntas, este noviembre, nos aseguraremos de que nunca lo vuelvan a hacer‚Äù. La campa√±a de Biden, y en general los dem√≥cratas, quieren hacer de los derechos reproductivos y del acceso a la atenci√≥n m√©dica para mujeres un tema central de la campa√±a, inspirados en las victorias electorales logradas en 2022 luego que la Corte Suprema anul√≥ el derecho constitucional al [aborto.](https://gestion.pe/noticias/aborto/) Trump se atribuye la decisi√≥n del m√°ximo tribunal porque √©l nomin√≥ a tres jueces que empujaron el equilibrio ideol√≥gico del tribunal hacia la derecha. LEA TAMBI√âN: [Biden vislumbra un acuerdo de tregua entre Israel y Ham√°s la pr√≥xima semana] Comienza a destacar en el mundo empresarial recibiendo las noticias m√°s exclusivas del d√≠a en tu bandeja [Aqu√≠]. Si a√∫n no tienes una cuenta, [Reg√≠strate gratis]y s√© parte de nuestra comunidad.
